task.name: Presentation: About JDogs
task.notes: Outline of the game with its goals, rules and mechanics. Have a very clear and well thought out concept of your game.

task.name: Presentation: Who? What? When?
task.notes: Project timeline and responsibilities.

task.name: Presentation: Networking
task.notes: Overview of the functionality of client and server.

task.name: Presentation: Requirement Analysis
task.notes: Overview of the software requirements (not required software).

task.name: Presentation: Mockup
task.notes: Show a self made mockup of your game during the presentation.

task.name: Product: Ahead of Schedule and Under Budget!
task.notes: You have already started producing relevant code for your project.

task.name: Process: Dear Diary
task.notes: Project diary exists and is readable. The diary has at least one meaningful entry.

task.name: Milestone 1
task.notes:
Präsentation von 10 – 15 min pro Gruppe
In der Präsentation werden folgende Details erwartet: – Beschreibung des Ziels des Spieles und der zugehörigen Spielregeln – Präsentation der Anforderungen an die zu entwickelnde Software – Festlegung der Funktionalität von Client und Server (welche Server- Funktionalität kann der Client aufrufen), noch ohne Beschreibung des Protokolls – Projektorganisation: Arbeitsplan/Balkendiagramm, Zuständigkeiten

task.name: Product: Login
task.notes: Arbitrarily many clients can log on to the server.

task.name: Product: Logout
task.notes: The server handles a client logout in a meaningful way.

task.name: Product: Protocol Code
task.notes: The human-readable network protocol is defined and documented in the source code.

task.name: Product: Chat
task.notes: Client to client chat is working.

task.name: Product: Protocol Document
task.notes: The human-readable network protocol is defined in a dedicated document.

task.name: Product: Ping
task.notes: A ping message is regularly sent from server to client and processed meaningfully (connection losses are detected and handled).

task.name: Product: Pong
task.notes: A ping message is regularly sent from client to server and processed meaningfully (connection losses are detected and handled).

task.name: Product: Call Me Bob
task.notes:
Players can change their nicknames.
The server assures that player nicknames are unique and changes duplicates in a consistent manner by assigning appropriate names.
The client suggests a nickname based on the system username.

task.name: Product: .gitignore - Check
task.notes: There is a gitignore file containing entries relevant for major operating systems and the used tools.

task.name: Process: /**...*/ - Check
task.notes: Source code is sufficiently documented.

task.name: Product: Encoding Error
task.notes: Protocol and content is properly encoded, decoded and validated.

task.name: Product: .gitignore - Last check
task.notes: There is a gitignore file containing entries relevant for major operating systems and the used tools.

task.name: Process: /**...*/ - Last check
task.notes: Source code is sufficiently documented.

task.name: Process: Dear Diary
task.notes: Project diary is up to date and filled with meaningful entries.

task.name: Process: Dear Diary
task.notes: Project diary is up to date and filled with meaningful entries.

task.name: Milestone 2
task.notes:
Dieser Meilenstein besteht aus dem Vorzeigen des Projekts in den Übungsstunden der Woche vom 29.03.2021.
Die Anforderung für diesen Projektmeilenstein ist die Implementierung eines Java Client/Server-Systems mit einfachen Socket-Verbindungen. – Netzwerk-Kommunikation eines Servers mit mehreren Clients implementiert (via Socket-Verbindungen, z.B. java.net.*).

task.name: Product: Broadcast
task.notes: Broadcast to all clients across all games and lobbies is working and has a dedicated command.

task.name: Product: Build Script
task.notes: The build script succeeds and produces an executable jar & javadoc for the task "build-cs108".

task.name: Product: Command Line
task.notes: Command line parameters are parsed correctly: (client <hostadress>:<port> [<username>] | server <port>).

task.name: Presentation: About JDogs
task.notes: Outline of the game with its goals, rules and mechanics.

task.name: Presentation: Demo!
task.notes: Present a working prototype (Terminal or GUI) of the game in the presentation.

task.name: Product: GUI
task.notes: The chat is available via a basic GUI.

task.name: Product: Game List
task.notes: There is a way to list open, ongoing as well as finished games. Their status is indicated.

task.name: Product: Game Logic
task.notes: The main logic of the game as well as its fundamental mechanics are present and the game is playable.

task.name: Product: Game State
task.notes: Game state is kept on server.

task.name: Product: Librarian
task.notes: Use at least one external library besides JUnit. JavaFX does not count as an external library.

task.name: Product: Lounging
task.notes: Have support for multiple lobbies (one per game) with their respective internal chats.

task.name: Product: Lounging List
task.notes: There is a way to list players in lobbies.

task.name: Product: Manual
task.notes: There is a manual which describes how the game is to be played.

task.name: Product: Player List
task.notes: There is a way to list all players currently connected to the server.

task.name: Presentation: Progress Report
task.notes: How things are going - project timeline and responsibilities, changes and problems.

task.name: Product: Protocol Code
task.notes: Network protocol is completely defined and documented in source code.

task.name: Product: Protocol Document
task.notes: The definition of the network protocol in the external document is up to date.

task.name: Presentation: QA
task.notes:
Present your QA measures which can also be found in the updated document.
Have a well thought out and detailed written QA concept and a solid and realistic plan on how to implement it. If possible, have a first result of your metrics.

task.name: Presentation: Rules to Code
task.notes: How is the gamestate and game logic represented in the code.

task.name: Product: Shall We Play a Game
task.notes: Present a working prototype of the game logic in the exercise slot by playing the game (Terminal or GUI).

task.name: Presentation: Technology!
task.notes: Describe tools, libraries and processes which you use that are not introduced in the lecture and why you use them.

task.name: Product: Whisper
task.notes: Whisper-chat between two clients is working.

task.name: Process: Who? What? When?
task.notes: Update and adjust your project plan for milestones 4 and 5.

task.name: Process: /**...*/ - Check
task.notes: Source code is sufficiently documented.

task.name: Process: Dear Diary
task.notes: Project diary is up to date and filled with meaningful entries.

task.notes: Project diary is up to date and filled with meaningful entries.

task.notes: Project diary is up to date and filled with meaningful entries.

task.name: Milestone 3
task.notes:
Präsentation im Plenum, alle Gruppen.
In der Woche der Meilensteinpräsentationen der aktuelle Status des Projekts auch in den Übungsgruppen bewertet. Anforderungen für diesen Projektmeilenstein: – Kernkomponenten des Spieles (Spiel-Management) sind implementiert, allerdings noch ohne Regelüberprüfung und ohne grafische Oberfläche, für die Lobby und den Chat ist einer GUI vorhanden.
– Kurze Diskussion: Welche Massnahmen zur Erhöhung der Softwarequalität haben Sie angewendet / werden Sie anwenden? – Folien zum Status des Projekts • Aktueller Stand des Projekts (erwartete Inhalte des Meilensteins) • Stand im Vergleich zum Arbeitsplan – Erklärung der verwendeten Technologien und Libraries – Welche Komponenten funktionieren, welche nicht (und warum)? Inhalte der Besprechung mit den Betreuern in der Übungsstunde: – Besprechung der offenen Fragen, die in der Präsentation aufgeworfen wurden – Überprüfung des Projektstandes entsprechend den Projektvorgaben. Gibt es ungelöste Probleme?

task.name: Product: GUI
task.notes:
The game is represented graphically.
The game is fully playable from the UI. Text input is only used where absolutely necessary.

task.name: Product: High Score
task.notes: There is a high score list which is stored persistently, updated when needed and availble for clients.

task.name: Process: Peer Precision
task.notes: Your assessment of the other games matches our assessment with a deviation of at most one achievement.

task.name: Product: Referee
task.notes: The rules of the game are checked and enforced correctly.

task.name: Presentation: Shall We Play A Game
task.notes: Present the working game in the excercise slot by playing the game.

task.name: Product: Unit-Test
task.notes:
All relevant features of a core component of your game are tested.
Unit-Tests are sufficient and meaningful.

task.name: Product: Victory!
task.notes: The winner and the win state is correctly determined.

task.notes: Source code is sufficiently documented.

task.name: Milestone 4
task.notes: Anforderung für Meilenstein 4: – Es ist eine erste Version der GUI für das Spiel vorhanden – Die kompletten Spielregeln sind implementiert Ziel ist es, ein erstes lauffähiges Client/Server Spiel mit GUI-Unterstützung verfügbar zu haben.

task.name: Presentation: About JDogs
task.notes:
Outline of the game with its goals, rules and mechanics.
Have a clear introduction to your game explaining its fundamentals in such a way that a first-time listener can understand it.

task.name: Product: Architecture
task.notes: Have documentation outlining the overall program architecture.

task.name: Process: Archiving
task.notes: Your repository contains an outreach/ folder with the specified content.

task.name: Product: Command Line
task.notes: Command line parameters are still parsed correctly.

task.name: Presentation: Demo!
task.notes: Have a bugfree demo of the game in the final presentation.

task.name: Product: GUI
task.notes: The GUI works without any errors and all client functionality is accessible by it.

task.name: Product: Game Logic
task.notes: The entire logic of the game as well as all its mechanics are present and the game is fully playable.

task.name: Product: High Score
task.notes: There is a high score list which is stored persistently, updated when needed and shown when requested.

task.name: Product: Login
task.notes: Arbitrarily many clients can still log on to the server.

task.name: Presentation: Logo
task.notes: The game and/or team has a proper Logo.

task.name: Product: Manual
task.notes: There is a manual which describes how the game is to be played.

task.name: Product: Pachydermatous Librarian
task.notes: All external libraries in your project are managed by gradle via maven central.

task.name: Product: Picturesque
task.notes: Have a representative screenshot of the game.

task.name: Product: Protocol Code
task.notes: Final version of network protocol is completely defined and documented in source code.

task.name: Product: Protocol Document
task.notes: The final version of the network protocol is current in external documentation.

task.name: Presentation: QA
task.notes: Results of Quality Assurance measures and lessons learned from them.

task.name: Product: QA Report
task.notes:
QA report with goals, methods and results.
Detailed and relevant analysis of QA measures over time, discussion of results, well-written report.

task.name: Presentation: Shall We Play A Game
task.notes: Present the working final game in the excercise slot by playing the game.

task.name: Presentation: Technology!
task.notes:
Describe tools, libraries and processes which you use that are not introduced in the lecture and why you use them.
Use at least two libraries besides JUnit actively for a significant / impactful task in your project. JavaFX does not count.

task.name: Product: Twitchy
task.notes: Have a representative video showing somewhere between 20 seconds and 2 minutes of gameplay.

task.name: Product: Unit-Test
task.notes: All unit-tests are meaningful and 'green'.

task.notes: Lessons Learned.

task.name: Milestone 5
task.notes: Ziel dieses Meilensteins ist die Abschlusspräsentation des gesamten Projekts im Plenum. – Präsentation des gesamten Projekts (inklusive einer Live-Demonstration) – Bitte Live-Demonstration und insbesondere die Netzwerk-Kommunikation im WLAN im Hörsaal (Netzwerk: DMI PROGRAMMING) oder in Ihrem Gruppen-VPN (Hamachi) vorher testen – Charakteristischer Screenshot des Spiels – Präsentation der Details zu den durchgeführten Qualitätssicherungs- massnahmen (dies soll in der Übungsgruppe vorgeführt werden) – Lessons Learned: was haben Sie in diesem Projekt gelernt, was würden Sie wieder so machen, was würden Sie beim nächsten Projekt verändern?
